source: Sayyid Abul Ala Maududi - Tafhim al-Qur'an - The Meaning of the Quran
short_text: This Surah is entitled Ar Rahman, the word with which it begins. This title, however, deeply relates to the subject matter of the Surah too, for in it, from the beginning to the end, the manifestations and fruits of Allah's attribute of mercy and grace have been mentioned.
text:
This Surah is entitled Ar Rahman, the word with which it begins. This title, however, deeply relates to the subject matter of the Surah too, for in it, from the beginning to the end, the manifestations and fruits of Allah's attribute of mercy and grace have been mentioned.

Period of Revelation

The commentators generally hold the view that this is a Makki Surah, though according to some traditions which have been cited on the authority of Hadrat Abdullah bin Abbas, Ikrimah and Qatadah, it was revealed at Madinah. But, firstly, there are also some other traditions from these very authorities, which contradict this view; secondly, its subject matter bears a closer resemblance with the Makki Surahs than with the Madani Surahs; rather it appears to belong to the very early Makkah period. However, there are several authentic traditions which testify that it had been revealed in Makkah itself many years before the hijrah.

Musnad Ahmad contains a tradition from Hadarat Asma, daughter of Abu Bakr (may Allah bless them both), to the effect: "I saw the Messenger of Allah offering his Prayers in the sacred precincts of the Ka'bah facing the corner in which the "Black Stone" is fixed. This relates to the time when the Divine Command, fasda bi-ma tumar ("So, proclaim publicly, O Prophet, what you are being commanded") had not yet been revealed. The polytheists at that time were hearing the words, Fa-biayyi alaa'i Rabbi kuma tukadhdhi ban, being recited by him in the Prayer." This shows than this Surah had been sent down even before Surah Al-Hijr.

Al-Bazzar, Ibn Jarir, Ibn Al- Mundhir, Daraqutni (in Al Afrad), Ibn Marduyah and Ibn Al Khatib (in Al- Tarikh) have related, on the authority of Hadrat Abdullah bin Umar, that once the Holy Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) recited Surah Ar-Rahman himself, or heard it recited before him : then he said to the people: How is it that I am not hearing from you the kind of good answer that the jinn had given to their Lord?When the people asked what it was he replied: "As I recited the Divine Words, Fa bi- ayyi alaa'i Rabbi-kuma tukadhdhiban, the jinn in response would repeat the words La bi shai'in min ni'mati Rabbi- na nukadhdhib : "We do not deny any of our Lord's blessings."

A similar theme has been related by Tirmidhi, Hakim and Hafiz Abu Bakr al-Bazzar from Hadrat Jabir bin Abdullah. Their tradition contains these words: "When the people kept silent on hearing the Surah Ar-Rahman, the Holy Prophet said 'I recited this very Surah before the jinn in the night when they had gathered together to hear the Qur'an. They responded to it better than you have. As I recited the Divine Words, Fa bi ayyi alaa'i Rabbikuma tukadhdhiban ("O jinn and men, which blessings of your Lord will you deny?") they would respond to it, saying: O our Lord, do not deny any of your blessings Praise is for You alone'!"

This tradition indicates that on the occasion of the incident that bas been related in Surah Al Ahqaf(vv. 29-32) of the jinn's hearing the Qur'an from the Holy Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) he was reciting Surah Ar Rahman in the Prayer. This happened in the 10th year of the Prophethood when the Holy Prophet had halted at Makkah on his way back from Ta'if. Although in some other traditions it has been reported that the Holy Prophet did not know then that the jinn were hearing him recite the Qur'an, but afterwards Allah had informed him of this, it is not unreasonable to suppose that just as Allah had informed him of the jinn's hearing the Qur'an so also Allah Himself might have told him as to what answer they were giving on hearing Surah Ar Rahman.

These traditions only indicate that Surah Ar Rahman had been revealed even before Surahs Al-Hijr and Al-Ahqaf. Besides, we come across another tradition which shows that it is one of those Surahs which were the earliest Revelations at Makkah. Ibn Ishaq has related this on the authority of Hadrat Urwah bin Zubair: The Companions one day said to one another: "The Quraish have never heard any one recite the Qur'an publicly to them, and who would read out the Divine Word aloud to them Hadrat Abdullah bin Masud said that he would. The Companions expressed the apprehension that he might be subjected to a harsh treatment and said that it should better be done by a person of a powerful family, who would protect him if the Quraish tried to subject him to violence. Hadrat Abdullah said: 'Let me alone : my Protector is Allah.' So early next morning he went to the Ka'bah while the Quraish chiefs were sitting in their respective conferences. Hadrat Abdullah arrived at the Maqam (station of
Abraham) and began to recite Surah Ar- Rahman raising his voice as he did so. The Quraish first tried for a while to understand what he was saying. Then,when they realized that it was the Word that Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was representing as the Word of God, they fell upon him and began to hit him in the face. But Hadrat Abdullah was not deterred : he continued to receive the slaps and to read the Qur'an as long as he could, At last, when he returned with a swollen face, the Companions said that they apprehended the same. He replied: 'God's enemies were never so light for me as they were today. If you say I'll recite the Qur'an to them again tomorrow.' They all said, 'No, you have done enough; you have made them listen to what they didn't want to bear.'" (Ibn Hisham, vol. 1, p. 336).

Theme and Subject Matter

This is the only Surah of the Qur'an in which besides men the jinn also, who are the other creation of the earth endowed with freedom of will and action, have been directly addressed, and both men and jinn have been made to realize the wonders of Allah's power, His countless blessings, their own helplessness and accountability before Him, and have been warned of the evil consequences of His disobedience and made aware of the best results of His obedience. Although at several other places in the Qur'an there are clear pointers to show that like the men the jinn too are a creation who have been endowed with freedom of will and action and are accountable, who have been granted the freedom of belief and unbelief, of obedience and disobedience, and among them too there are the believers and the unbelievers, the obedient and the rebellious, as among human beings, and among them too there exist such groups as have believed in the Prophets sent by God and in the Divine Books, this Surah
clearly points out that the message of the Holy Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and the Qur'an is meant both for men and for jinn and that his Prophethood is not restricted to human beings alone.

Although in the beginning of the Surah the address is directed only to human beings, for to them only belongs the vicegerency" of the earth, among them only have the Messengers of Allah been raised, and in their tongues only have the Divine Books been revealed, yet from verse 13 onward both the men and the jinn have been addressed and one and the same invitation has been extended to both.

The themes of the Surah have been couched in brief sentences in a specific sequence:

In vv. 1-4 it has been stated that the teaching of the Qur'an is from Allah Almighty and it is the very demand of His mercy that He should provide guidance to mankind through this teaching, for it is He Who has created man as a rational and intelligent being.

In vv. 5-6 it has been said that the whole system of the Universe is functioning under Allah's Sovereignty and everything in the earth and heavens is subject to His Command alone.

In vv. 7-9 another important truth that has been expressed is that Allah has established the entire system of the Universe precisely and equitably on justice, and the nature of this system requires that those who dwell in it also should adhere to justice within the bounds of their authority and should not disturb the balance.

In vv. 10-25 besides mentioning the wonders and excellences of Allah's might, references have been made to His those bounties from which the jinn and men are deriving benefit.

In vv. 26-30 both the men and the jinn have been reminded of the truths that in this Universe no one except One God is immortal and imperishable, and there is none, from the lowest to the highest, who does not stand in need of God for his survival and other requirements. Whatever is happening here, from the earth to the heavens, is happening under His administration and control.

In vv. 31-36 both the groups have been warned that the time is fast approaching when they will be called to account, which they will not be able to avoid, for God's Kingdom is encircling them from every side; it is not in their power to flee it; if they are involved in the misunderstanding that they can, they may try to do so.

In vv. 37-38 it has been said that this accountability will be held on the Day of Resurrection.

In vv. 39-45 the evil end of the guilty ones, from among men and jinn, who have been disobeying Allah in the world has been mentioned.

And from verse 46 to the end of the Surah mention has been made of those rewards and blessings which will be granted to the righteous men and jinn who have led pious lives in the world and lived with a clear understanding that they will have to appear before their Lord one day and render an account of their deeds and actions.

This whole discourse is couched in oratorical language. It is a spirited and eloquent address in the course of which after mentioning each of the wonders of Allah's great power, and each of the blessings bestowed by Him, and each of the manifestations of His Sovereignty and dominion, and each of the details of His punishment and rewards, the jinn and men have been over and over again questioned: "Which then of the bounties and favors of your Lord will you deny ?" Below we shall explain that alaa is a word with many shades of meaning, which has been used in different senses at different places in this discourse, and this question to the the jinn and men bears its own special meaning at every place according to the context.
description: The surah that crowns the Quran and opens with the chant of a single word proclaiming one of God’s most beautiful names, The All-Beneficent. It takes its name from verse 1 which mentions “the All-beneficent” (al-raḥmān). The surah highlights Gods wonders in this world, describes the end of the world, and paints an evocative picture of the delights of Paradise. Hell is briefly contrasted (verse 43 .) with the joys that await the righteous. The surah is characterized by the refrain “So which of your Lord’s bounties will you both deny?” which runs throughout. The surah divides mankind and jinn into three classes: the disbelievers (verse 41 .), the best of believers (verse 46 .), and the ordinary believers (verse 62 .).The surah is also known as: (God) Most Gracious, The All-Merciful, The Beneficent, The Lord of Mercy, The Merciful, The Mercy-giving, The Most Gracious.

Efendi Nahi.verse 55:4: ia ka mësuar të shprehurit (e mendimeve dhe ndjenjave).
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:5: Dielli dhe Hëna (lëvizin) sipas llogarisë (rrugës) së caktuar,
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:6: edhe bimët (e imëta) dhe drunjt i përulen (Perëndisë),
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:7: e qiellin e ka ngritur dhe ka vënë masë (drejtësinë),
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:8: për të mos kaluar (kufirin) në matje –
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:9: dhe matni drejt e mos mungoni në teresi!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:10: Tokën e ka bërë (shtruar) për krijesa,
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:11: në të ka pemë të llojllojshme dhe hurme me frute (në gëzhojë),
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:12: dhe drithëra me gjethe dhe bimë me erë të mirë, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:13: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj (o njerëz dhe xhindë) po i përgënjeshtroni (mohoni)?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:14: Ai e krijoi njeriun prej baltës së thatë, ashtu siç është vorba e pjekur,
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:15: e xhindët i krijoi prej flakës së zjarrit –
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:16: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:17: (Ai është) Zoti i dy lindjee dhe i dy perëndimeve (dy solsticeve),
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:18: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:19: I ka lëshuar dy dete që të takohen,
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:20: e, në mes tyre ka stom (pengesë), andaj njëri nuk e mbizotëron tjetrin (nuk përzihen) –
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:21: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:22: Prej tyre nxirren margaritarë dhe korale (merxhanë) –
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:23: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:24: Atij i përkasin edhe anijet që lundrojnë nëpër dete dhe krijonë dallgë si malet,
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:25: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:26: Cdo gjë që është në Tokë është e kalueshme (do të shkatërrohet),
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:27: e mbetet vetëm Zoti yt, i Madhërueshmi dhe Bamirësi –
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:28: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:29: Prej Tij kërkojnë çka ka në qiej dhe në tokë; në çdo moment Ai është në gjendje (të krijojë, të shpërblejë, të zhdukë), -
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:30: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:31: Do t’ju qëllojmë juve (për shpërblim dhe llogari), o ju, dy barrët e Tokës (njerëzit dhe xhindët)?! -
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:32: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:33: O grpe të xhindëve dhe njerëzve, nëse mund të dilni prej kufijve të qiejve dhe të Tokës, dilni, por do të mund të dilni vetëm me fuqi të madhe (e këtë nuk e keni, andaj nuk mund të ikni)!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:34: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:35: Kundër jush do të dërgohet flaka e zjarrit dhe bakër i shkrirë dhe ju nuk do të mund të mbroheni, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:36: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:37: E kur të çahet qielli dhe të bëhet i kuq si trëndafilja dhe si vaji i shkrirë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:38: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:39: atë Ditë njerëzit dhe xhindët nuk do të pyetën për mëkatet e tyre, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:40: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:41: e mëkatarët atëherë, do të njihen sipas pamjes (së fytyrës së tyre) dhe do të kapen për flokë (kacule) dhe për këmbë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:42: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:43: (Atyre u thuhet): “Ja, ky është xhehennemi të cilin e përgënjeshtronin mëkatarët!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:44: Ata do të sillen në mes zjarrit dhe ujit të vëluar ë ka arritur shkallën më të lartë të vëlimit!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:45: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:46: E, për ata që i druajnë paraqitjes para Zotit të vet, do të kenë dy xhennete,
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:47: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:49: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:50: në të ka burime që rrjedhin
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:51: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:52: në ta – prej çdo lloj peme, ka nga dy lloje, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:53: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:54: (ata do të jenë) të mbështetur në shtrojet, astari i të cilave është prej mëndafshi të trashë, e frytet e dy xhenneteve do të jenë të afërta (për t’i kapë me dorë),
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:55: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:56: Në ta, do të jenë ato (virxhëreshat), me sy ulur, të cilat – para tyre, nuk kanë pasur takim as me njerëz as me xhindë,
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:57: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:58: ato do të jenë si rubin (gurë të çmueshëm) dhe merxhanë (korale),
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:59: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:60: Vallë, për veprën e mirë, a ka tjetër shpërblim pos të mirë?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:61: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:62: E, nën këto dy (xhennete) janë edye dy xhennete (tjera), -
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:63: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:64: (Këta dy janë) të stolisur me gjelbërim,
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:65: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:66: në to janë dy burime (të përhershme) fiskishë (që hedhin lart ujin),
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:67: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:68: në to ka pemë, hurme dhe shega,
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:69: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:70: në to ka bukuroshe virtytesh të mrekullueshme,
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:71: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:72: hyritë (e xhennetit) të kufizuara më shatorra,
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:73: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:74: të cilat – para tyre, nuk kanë pasur takim as me njerëz as me xhindë, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:75: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:76: Ata do të rrinë mbështetur në shtroje të gjelbëra, të mrekullueshme dhe të bukura, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:77: e, cilat dhunti të Zotit tuaj po i përgënjeshtroni?!
Efendi Nahi.verse 55:78: Eshtë i lartësuar emri i Zotit tënd, të Madhërueshëm dhe Bamirës! përgënjeshtroni?!

null.verse 55:4: Ona danışmağı (fikrini və duyğularını bəyan etməyi) öyrətdi.
null.verse 55:5: Günəş və ay müəyyən bir ölçü ilə (hərəkət edər).
null.verse 55:6: Otlar da, ağaclar da (Allaha) səcdə edər!
null.verse 55:7: Göyü.
null.verse 55:8: Ona görə ki, çəkidə hədi aşmayasınız (insafı əldən verməyəsiniz).
null.verse 55:9: Tərəzini düz tutun, çəkini əskiltməyin! (Cəkidə insaflı olun, tərəzini korlamayın!)
null.verse 55:10: Yeri də (bütün) məxluqat üçün O döşədi.
null.verse 55:11: Orada növbənöv meyvələr və tumurcuqlu (salxımlı) xurma ağacları;
null.verse 55:12: (Yaşıl ikən yarpar, quruluğunda saman olan) saçaqlı dənli bitkilər və xoş ətirli çiçəklər (reyhan, qızılgül, yasəmən, bənövşə, qərənfil və s.
null.verse 55:13: (Ey cinlər, ey insanlar!) Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:14: İnsanı (Adəmi) saxsı kimi (toxunduqda səs çıxardan) quru palçıqdan O yaratdı.
null.verse 55:15: (Cinlərin əcdadı) cannı da tüstüsüz (təmiz) oddan O xəlq etdi.
null.verse 55:16: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:17: İki məşriqin və iki məğribin Rəbbi (günəşin və ayın yazda və qışda çıxıb batdığı yerlərin sahibi) Odur.
null.verse 55:18: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:19: (Suları şirin və acı olan) iki dənizi O qovuşdurdu (bir-birinə qovuşmaq üçün açıb buraxdı).
null.verse 55:20: Amma onların arasında maneə vardır, bir-birinə qatışmazlar (özləri üçün müəyyən edilmiş həddi aşmazlar).
null.verse 55:21: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:22: Onlardan (o iki dənizdən) inci və mərcan çıxar.
null.verse 55:23: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:24: Dənizdə uca dağlar kimi üzən gəmilər də Onundur.
null.verse 55:25: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:26: (Yer) üzündə olan hər kəs fanidir (ölümə məhkumdur).
null.verse 55:27: Ancaq əzəmət və kərəm sahibi olan Rəbbinin zatı baqidir.
null.verse 55:28: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:29: Göylərdə və yerdə kim varsa, (hamısı) Ondan (ruzi, mərhəmət və mədəd) diləyər.
null.verse 55:30: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:31: Ey ağır yük (mükəlləfiyyət) altında olanlar (yaxud yerə ağırlıq verən cinlər və insanlar)! Sizinlə də (layiqincə) məşğul olacağıq (əməllərinizin haqq-hesabını mütləq çəkəcəyik).
null.verse 55:32: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:33: Ey cin və insan tayfası! Əgər göylərin və yerin ətrafından (çevrəsindən) kənara çıxa bilərsinizsə, çıxın.
null.verse 55:34: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:35: (Qiyamət günü) sizin üstünüzə tüstüsüz alov və alovsuz tüstü göndəriləcək (başınıza ərimiş mis, od və duman töküləcək) və siz bir-birinizə kömək də edə bilməyəcəksiniz.
null.verse 55:36: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:37: (Qiyamət günü) göy ayrılıb (dağ basılmış) dəri (yaxud dağ edilmiş yağ) kimi qıpqırmızı olduğu zaman (halınız necə olacaq)?!
null.verse 55:38: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:39: O gün nə bir insan, nə də bir cin günahı barəsində sorğu-sual olunmayacaqdır! (Yol ancaq Cəhənnəmdir!)
null.verse 55:40: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:41: Günahkarlar üzlərindən (sifətlərinin qaralığından, gözlərinin göylüyündən) tanınacaq, kəkillərindən və ayaqlarından tutulub yaxalanacaqlar (başları öndən, yaxud arxadan ayaqlarına bənd ediləcəkdir).
null.verse 55:42: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:43: (Onlara belə deyiləcəkdir: ) "Bu, günahkarların yalan hesab etdikləri Cəhənnəmdir!"
null.verse 55:44: Onlar onunla (cəhənnəm odu ilə) qaynar su arasında dolanıb duracaqlar.
null.verse 55:45: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:46: Şübhəsiz ki, Rəbbinin məqamından (hüzurunda haqq-hesab üçün durmaqdan) qorxanları iki cənnət (Ədn nə Nəim cənnətləri) gözləyir!
null.verse 55:47: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:48: (O iki cənnətin ağacları) qollu-budaqlıdır (merli-meyvəlidir).
null.verse 55:49: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:50: Orada (o cənnətlərdə) iki axar bulaq vardır.
null.verse 55:51: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:52: Orada (o iki cənnətdə) hər meyvədən (quru və təzətər olmaqla) iki növ vardır (mö'minlər onların birini dünyada görmüş, digərini isə görməmişlər).
null.verse 55:53: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:54: Onlar (mö'minlər) orada astarları qalın ipəkdən olan döşəklərə söykənmiş olacaqlar.
null.verse 55:55: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:56: Orada (o cənnətlərdə) gözlərini (yalnız ərlərinə) dikmiş, bundan əvvəl özlərinə heç bir ins-cins (insan və cin) toxunmamış qadınlar vardır.
null.verse 55:57: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:58: Onlar (o qadınlar rəng və gözəllikcə), sanki yaqut və mərcandırlar.
null.verse 55:59: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:60: Yaxşılıq əvəzi ancaq yaxşılıqdır!
null.verse 55:61: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:62: Onlardan (o iki cənnətdən) başqa (mö'minlər üçün) daha iki cənnət (Firdovs və Mə'va cənnətləri) vardır.
null.verse 55:63: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:64: (O iki cənnət) yamyaşıldır (o qədər yaşıldır ki, qaraya çalır).
null.verse 55:65: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:66: Orada (o iki cənnətdə) fəvvarə verib qaynayan iki bulaq vardır.
null.verse 55:67: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:68: Orada (o iki cənnətdə) növbənöv meyvələr, xurma və nar vardır.
null.verse 55:69: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:70: Orada (o cənnətlərin hamısında, dördündə də) xoş xasiyyətli, gözəl üzlü qadınlar vardır.
null.verse 55:71: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:72: Cadırlarda gözlərini (yalnız öz ərlərinə) dikmiş hurilər vardır.
null.verse 55:73: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:74: Onlara (ərlərindən) əvvəl heç bir ins-cins toxunmamışdır.
null.verse 55:75: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:76: Onlar (mö'minlər) yaşıl balışlara və gözəl naxışlı (inci ilməli, xovlu) xalılara (yaxud yumşaq qalın döşəklərə) söykənmiş olacaqlar.
null.verse 55:77: Belə olduqda Rəbbinizin hansı ne'mətlərini yalan saya bilərsiniz?!
null.verse 55:78: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) Sənin əzəmət və kərəm sahibi olan Rəbbinin adı nə qədər ucadır (nə qədər uludur)!

null.verse 55:5: Sunce i Mjesec utvrđenim putanjama plove,
null.verse 55:6: i trava i drveće se pokoravaju,
null.verse 55:7: a nebo je digao.
null.verse 55:8: da ne prelazite granice u mjerenju -
null.verse 55:9: i pravo mjerite i na teraziji ne zakidajte!
null.verse 55:10: A Zemlju je za stvorenja razastro,
null.verse 55:11: na njoj ima voća i palmi sa plodom u čaškama
null.verse 55:12: i žita sa lišćem i miomirisna cvijeća -
null.verse 55:13: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete!
null.verse 55:14: On je čovjeka od sasušene ilovače, kao što je grnčarija, stvorio
null.verse 55:15: a džina od plamene vatre -
null.verse 55:16: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?! -
null.verse 55:17: Gospodara dva istoka i dva zapada -
null.verse 55:18: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:19: Pustio je dva mora da se dodiruju,
null.verse 55:20: između njih je pregrada i oni se ne miješaju -
null.verse 55:21: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:22: Iz njih se vadi biser i merdžan -
null.verse 55:23: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:24: Njegove su i lađe koje se kao brda visoko po moru uzdižu -
null.verse 55:25: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:26: Sve što je na Zemlji prolazno je,
null.verse 55:27: ostaje samo Gospodar tvoj, Veličanstveni i Plemeniti -
null.verse 55:28: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:29: Njemu se mole oni koji su na nebesima i na Zemlji; svakog časa On se zanima nečim -
null.verse 55:30: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:31: Polagaćete Mi račun, o ljudi i džini -
null.verse 55:32: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:33: O družine džina i ljudi, ako možete da preko granica nebesa i Zemlje prodrete, prodrite, moći ćete prodrijeti jedino uz veliku moć! -
null.verse 55:34: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:35: Na vas će se ognjen plamen i rastopljeni mjed prolivati, i vi se nećete moći odbraniti -
null.verse 55:36: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:37: A kad se nebo razdvoji i kao ucvrkan zejtin rumeno postane -
null.verse 55:38: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?! -
null.verse 55:39: tog Dana ljudi i džini za grijehe svoje neće biti pitani -
null.verse 55:40: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?! -
null.verse 55:41: a grješnici će se po biljezima svojim poznati, pa će za kike i noge ščepani biti -
null.verse 55:42: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:43: Evo, to je Džehennem koji su grješnici poricali!
null.verse 55:44: I između vatre i ključale vode oni će kružiti -
null.verse 55:45: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:46: A za onoga koji se stajanja pred Gospodarom svojim bojao, biće dva perivoja -
null.verse 55:47: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?! -
null.verse 55:48: puna stabala granatih -
null.verse 55:49: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?! -
null.verse 55:50: u kojima će biti dva izvora koja će teći -
null.verse 55:51: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?! -
null.verse 55:52: u njima će od svakog voća po dvije vrste biti -
null.verse 55:53: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:54: Odmaraće se na posteljama čije će postave od kadife biti, a plodovi u oba perivoja nadohvat ruke će stajati -
null.verse 55:55: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:56: U njima će biti one koje preda se gledaju, one koje, prije njih, ni čovjek ni džin nije dodirnuo -
null.verse 55:57: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:58: biće kao rubin i biser -
null.verse 55:59: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:60: Zar nagrada za dobro učinjeno djelo može biti nešto drugo do dobro?! -
null.verse 55:61: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:62: Osim ta dva, biće još dva neznatnija perivoja -
null.verse 55:63: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?! -
null.verse 55:65: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?! -
null.verse 55:66: sa izvorima koji prskaju, u svakom -
null.verse 55:67: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:68: u njima će biti voća, i palmi - i šipaka -
null.verse 55:69: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:70: u njima će biti ljepotica naravi divnih -
null.verse 55:71: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?! -
null.verse 55:72: hurija u šatorima skrivenih -
null.verse 55:73: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?! -
null.verse 55:74: koje prije njih ni čovjek ni džin nije dodirnuo -
null.verse 55:75: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:76: Oni će biti naslonjeni na uzglavlja zelena, prekrivena ćilimima čarobnim i prekrasnim -
null.verse 55:77: pa, koju blagodat Gospodara svoga poričete?!
null.verse 55:78: Neka je uzvišeno ime Gospodara tvoga, Veličanstvenog i Plemenitog! poričete?!

null.verse 55:5: সূর্য ও চন্দ্র হিসাবমত চলে।
null.verse 55:6: এবং তৃণলতা ও বৃক্ষাদি সেজদারত আছে।
null.verse 55:7: তিনি আকাশকে করেছেন সমুন্নত এবং স্থাপন করেছেন তুলাদন্ড।
null.verse 55:8: যাতে তোমরা সীমালংঘন না কর তুলাদন্ডে।
null.verse 55:9: তোমরা ন্যায্য ওজন কায়েম কর এবং ওজনে কম দিয়ো না।
null.verse 55:10: তিনি পৃথিবীকে স্থাপন করেছেন সৃষ্টজীবের জন্যে।
null.verse 55:11: এতে আছে ফলমূল এবং বহিরাবরণবিশিষ্ট খর্জুর বৃক্ষ।
null.verse 55:12: আর আছে খোসাবিশিষ্ট শস্য ও সুগন্ধি ফুল।
null.verse 55:13: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অনুগ্রহকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:14: তিনি মানুষকে সৃষ্টি করেছেন পোড়া মাটির ন্যায় শুষ্ক মৃত্তিকা থেকে।
null.verse 55:15: এবং জিনকে সৃষ্টি করেছেন অগ্নিশিখা থেকে।
null.verse 55:16: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অনুগ্রহ অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:17: তিনি দুই উদয়াচল ও দুই অস্তাচলের মালিক।
null.verse 55:18: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:19: তিনি পাশাপাশি দুই দরিয়া প্রবাহিত করেছেন।
null.verse 55:20: উভয়ের মাঝখানে রয়েছে এক অন্তরাল, যা তারা অতিক্রম করে না।
null.verse 55:21: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:22: উভয় দরিয়া থেকে উৎপন্ন হয় মোতি ও প্রবাল।
null.verse 55:23: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:24: দরিয়ায় বিচরণশীল পর্বতদৃশ্য জাহাজসমূহ তাঁরই (নিয়ন্ত্রনাধীন)
null.verse 55:25: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:26: ভূপৃষ্টের সবকিছুই ধ্বংসশীল।
null.verse 55:27: একমাত্র আপনার মহিমায় ও মহানুভব পালনকর্তার সত্তা ছাড়া।
null.verse 55:28: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:29: নভোমন্ডল ও ভূমন্ডলের সবাই তাঁর কাছে প্রার্থী। তিনি সর্বদাই কোন না কোন কাজে রত আছেন।
null.verse 55:30: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:31: যে ব্যক্তি তার পালনকর্তার সামনে পেশ হওয়ার ভয় রাখে, তার জন্যে রয়েছে দু’টি উদ্যান।
null.verse 55:32: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:33: উভয় উদ্যানই ঘন শাখা-পল্লববিশিষ্ট।
null.verse 55:34: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:35: উভয় উদ্যানে আছে বহমান দুই প্রস্রবন।
null.verse 55:36: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:37: উভয়ের মধ্যে প্রত্যেক ফল বিভিন্ন রকমের হবে।
null.verse 55:38: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:39: তারা তথায় রেশমের আস্তরবিশিষ্ট বিছানায় হেলান দিয়ে বসবে। উভয় উদ্যানের ফল তাদের নিকট ঝুলবে।
null.verse 55:40: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:41: তথায় থাকবে আনতনয়ন রমনীগন, কোন জিন ও মানব পূর্বে যাদের ব্যবহার করেনি।
null.verse 55:42: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:43: প্রবাল ও পদ্মরাগ সদৃশ রমণীগণ।
null.verse 55:44: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:45: সৎকাজের প্রতিদান উত্তম পুরস্কার ব্যতীত কি হতে পারে?
null.verse 55:46: হে জিন ও মানব! আমি শীঘ্রই তোমাদের জন্যে কর্মমুক্ত হয়ে যাব।
null.verse 55:47: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:48: হে জিন ও মানবকূল, নভোমন্ডল ও ভূমন্ডলের প্রান্ত অতিক্রম করা যদি তোমাদের সাধ্যে কুলায়, তবে অতিক্রম কর। কিন্তু ছাড়পত্র ব্যতীত তোমরা তা অতিক্রম করতে পারবে না।
null.verse 55:49: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:50: ছাড়া হবে তোমাদের প্রতি অগ্নিস্ফুলিঙ্গ ও ধুম্রকুঞ্জ তখন তোমরা সেসব প্রতিহত করতে পারবে না।
null.verse 55:51: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:52: যেদিন আকাশ বিদীর্ণ হবে তখন সেটি রক্তবর্ণে রঞ্জিত চামড়ার মত হয়ে যাবে।
null.verse 55:53: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:54: সেদিন মানুষ না তার অপরাধ সম্পর্কে জিজ্ঞাসিত হবে, না জিন।
null.verse 55:55: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:56: অপরাধীদের পরিচয় পাওয়া যাবে তাদের চেহারা থেকে; অতঃপর তাদের কপালের চুল ও পা ধরে টেনে নেয়া হবে।
null.verse 55:57: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:58: এটাই জাহান্নাম, যাকে অপরাধীরা মিথ্যা বলত।
null.verse 55:59: তারা জাহান্নামের অগ্নি ও ফুটন্ত পানির মাঝখানে প্রদক্ষিণ করবে।
null.verse 55:60: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:61: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:62: এই দু’টি ছাড়া আরও দু’টি উদ্যান রয়েছে।
null.verse 55:63: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:65: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:66: তথায় আছে উদ্বেলিত দুই প্রস্রবণ।
null.verse 55:67: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:68: তথায় আছে ফল-মূল, খর্জুর ও আনার।
null.verse 55:69: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:70: সেখানে থাকবে সচ্চরিত্রা সুন্দরী রমণীগণ।
null.verse 55:71: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:72: তাঁবুতে অবস্থানকারিণী হুরগণ।
null.verse 55:73: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:74: কোন জিন ও মানব পূর্বে তাদেরকে স্পর্শ করেনি।
null.verse 55:75: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:76: তারা সবুজ মসনদে এবং উৎকৃষ্ট মূল্যবান বিছানায় হেলান দিয়ে বসবে।
null.verse 55:77: অতএব, তোমরা উভয়ে তোমাদের পালনকর্তার কোন কোন অবদানকে অস্বীকার করবে?
null.verse 55:78: কত পূণ্যময় আপনার পালনকর্তার নাম, যিনি মহিমাময় ও মহানুভব। করবে?

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:5: Слънцето и луната - [се движат] по изчисление,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:6: и звездите, и дърветата се прекланят.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:7: И въздигна Той небето, и положи везните,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:9: И отмервайте справедливо, и не ощетявайте в мярката!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:10: И положи Той земята за тварите.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:11: На нея има плодове и палми с обвити гроздове,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:12: и зърно с плява, и уханни растения.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:13: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:14: Сътвори Той човека от звънка глина като грънчарско изделие.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:15: И сътвори Той джиновете от пламъка на огъня.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:16: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:17: Господа на двата изгрева и Господа на двата залеза.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:18: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:19: Пусна Той двете морета да се срещнат,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:20: но между тях има преграда, която не престъпват.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:21: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:22: От двете излизат бисери и корали.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:23: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:24: И Негови са плаващите кораби, въздигнали се като планини в морето.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:25: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:27: Но пребъдва Ликът на твоя Господ, Владетеля на величието и почитта.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:28: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:29: Умолява Го всичко на небесата и на земята.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:30: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:31: Ще ви направим равносметка, о, два свята [на джинове и хора]!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:32: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:33: О, множество от джинове и хора, ако можете да проникнете зад пределите на небесата и на земята, проникнете! Не ще проникнете освен с власт [от Нас].
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:34: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:35: Ще бъде пратен срещу вас пламък от огън и дим, и не ще ви се помогне.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:36: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:37: И когато небето се разцепи, и стане червено като разтопено масло.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:38: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:39: В този Ден не ще бъде питан за греха му нито човек, нито джин.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:40: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:41: Престъпниците ще бъдат разпознати по техния белег.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:42: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:43: Това е Адът, който престъпниците взимат за лъжа.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:44: Те ще обикалят между него и вряща, кипяща вода.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:45: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:46: А за онзи, който се страхува да застане пред своя Господ, има две Градини -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:47: та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:49: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:51: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:52: Там от всеки плод има по два вида.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:53: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:54: Облегнати върху килими с подплата от брокат.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:55: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:56: Има там жени с целомъдрен поглед, недокоснати нито от човек преди тях, нито от джин.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:57: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:59: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:60: Нима въздаянието за добрината е друго освен добрина?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:61: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:62: И освен тях - още две градини
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:63: та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:65: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:66: В тях има два бликащи извора.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:67: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:68: Там има плодове и палми, и нарове.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:69: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:70: Там има добродетелни и прекрасни жени -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:71: та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:73: та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:74: недокоснати нито от човек преди тях, нито от джин.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:75: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:76: Облегнати върху зелени възглавници и хубави килими.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:77: Та кои блага на вашия Господ взимате за лъжа?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 55:78: Благословено да е името на твоя Господ, Владетеля на величието и почитта! лъжа?

null.verse 55:5: 日月是依定數而運行的。
null.verse 55:6: 草木是順從他的意旨的。
null.verse 55:7: 他曾將天升起。他曾規定公平，
null.verse 55:8: 以免你們用稱不公。
null.verse 55:9: 你們應當秉公地僅守衡度，你們不要使所稱之物份量不足。
null.verse 55:10: 他為眾生而將大地放下。
null.verse 55:11: 大地上有水果，和有花篦的海棗，
null.verse 55:12: 與有稈的五穀和香草。
null.verse 55:13: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:14: 他曾用陶器般的乾土創造人，
null.verse 55:15: 他用火焰創造精靈。
null.verse 55:16: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:17: 他是兩個東方的主，也是兩個西方的主。
null.verse 55:18: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:19: 他曾任兩海相交而會合，
null.verse 55:20: 兩海之間，有一個堤防，兩海互不侵犯。
null.verse 55:21: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:22: 他從兩海中取出大珍珠和小珍珠。
null.verse 55:23: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:24: 在海中桅帆高舉，狀如山巒的船舶，只是他的。
null.verse 55:25: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:26: 凡在大地上的，都要毀滅；
null.verse 55:27: 惟有你的主的本體，具有尊嚴與大德，將永恆存在。
null.verse 55:28: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:29: 凡在天地間的都仰求他；他時時都有事物。
null.verse 55:30: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:31: 精靈和人類啊！我將專心應付你們。
null.verse 55:32: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:33: 精靈和人類的群眾啊！如果你們能通過天地的境界，你們就通過吧！你們必須憑據一種權柄，才能通過。
null.verse 55:34: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:35: 火焰和火煙將被降於你們，而你們不能自衛。
null.verse 55:36: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:37: 當天破離的時候，天將變成玫瑰色，好像紅皮一樣。
null.verse 55:38: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:39: 在那日，任何人和精靈都不因罪過而受審問。
null.verse 55:40: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:41: 犯罪者將因他們的形跡而被認識，他們的額髮將被繫在腳掌上。
null.verse 55:42: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:43: 這是犯罪者所否認的火獄。
null.verse 55:44: 他們將往來於火獄和沸水之間。
null.verse 55:45: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:46: 凡怕站在主的御前受審問者，都得享受兩座樂園。
null.verse 55:47: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:48: 那兩座樂園，是有各種果樹的。
null.verse 55:49: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:50: 在那兩座樂園裡，有兩洞流行的泉源。
null.verse 55:51: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:52: 在那兩座樂園裡，每種水果，都有兩樣。
null.verse 55:53: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:54: 他們靠在用錦緞做裡子的坐褥上，那兩座樂園的水果，都是手所能及的。
null.verse 55:55: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:56: 在那些樂園中，有不視非禮的妻子；在他們的妻子之前，任何人和任何精靈都未與她們交接過。
null.verse 55:57: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:58: 她們好像紅寶石和小珍珠一樣。
null.verse 55:59: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:60: 行善者，只受善報。
null.verse 55:61: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:62: 次於那兩座樂園的，還有兩座樂園。
null.verse 55:63: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:64: 那兩座樂園都是蒼翠的。
null.verse 55:65: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:66: 在那兩座樂園裡，有兩洞湧出的泉源。
null.verse 55:67: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:68: 在那兩座樂園裡，有水果，有海棗，有石榴。
null.verse 55:69: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:70: 在那些樂園裡，有許多賢淑佳麗的女子。
null.verse 55:71: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:72: 她們是白皙的，是蟄居於帳幕中的。
null.verse 55:73: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:74: 在他們的妻子之前，任何人或精靈，都未曾與她們交接過。
null.verse 55:75: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:76: 他們靠在翠綠的坐褥和美麗的花毯上。
null.verse 55:77: 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？
null.verse 55:78: 多福哉，你具尊嚴和大德的主的名號！ 你們究竟否認你們的主的哪一件恩典呢？

null.verse 55:5: Slunce i měsíc své počty obsahují
null.verse 55:6: a traviny a stromy se před ním sklánějí.
null.verse 55:7: Nebe On vyzvedl a váhy stanovil
null.verse 55:8: na váze nepodvádějte,
null.verse 55:9: spravedlivě ji stanovte a na váhách neubírejte!
null.verse 55:10: A zemi, tu pro lidstvo rozprostřel,
null.verse 55:11: na ní ovoce a palmy s obaly plodů zrají
null.verse 55:12: i obilí na stéblech a rostliny, jež vůni libou mají.
null.verse 55:13: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:14: A člověka z hlíny podobné hrnčířské stvořil
null.verse 55:15: a džiny z plamene bezdýmného vytvořil.
null.verse 55:16: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:17: On Pánem je obou východů, i Pánem obou západů.
null.verse 55:18: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:19: A volně dal téci oběma mořím, jež se setkají,
null.verse 55:20: však mezi nimi překážka stojí, již nezdolají.
null.verse 55:21: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:22: A z obou moří se perly velké i malé loví.
null.verse 55:23: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:24: Jeho jsou i lodě plující, jež na moři ční jak znamení.
null.verse 55:25: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:26: Všichni, kdož na zemi jsou, dočkají se konce svého
null.verse 55:27: a zůstane jen tvář Pána tvého, majestátnosti a velkomyslnosti plného.
null.verse 55:28: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:29: A vzývají Jej ti, kdož na nebesích jsou i na zemi, a každý den On při díle je.
null.verse 55:30: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:31: A záhy i pro vás se uvolníme, ó břemena vy dvě!
null.verse 55:32: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:33: Ó shromáždění lidí a džinů! Jste-li schopni uniknout za nebes a země končiny, pak tam pronikněte! Však podaří se vám to jen s Naší plnou mocí.
null.verse 55:34: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:35: Bude na vás poslán plamen ohnivý a měď roztavená, a nebude vám pomoci!
null.verse 55:36: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:37: A až se nebesa rozpoltí a jak čerstvě stažená kůže zrudnou,
null.verse 55:38: - které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat? -
null.verse 55:39: v ten den lidé ani džinové na viny své tázáni nebudou.
null.verse 55:40: Které z dobrodiní Pana svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:41: Hříšníci podle známek svých budou poznáni a uchopeni za nohy a za kštici.
null.verse 55:42: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:43: Toto je to peklo, jež za lež prohlašovali hříšníci,
null.verse 55:44: a budou se kroutit mezi ním a vodou vroucí a varem kypící!
null.verse 55:45: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:46: A kdo se postavení Pána svého obával, ten dvě zahrady dostane,
null.verse 55:47: - které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat? -
null.verse 55:48: dvě zahrady plné listnatého větvoví
null.verse 55:49: - které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat? -
null.verse 55:50: a v obou z nich dva prameny potekou
null.verse 55:51: - které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat? -
null.verse 55:52: a v nich od každého ovoce dva druhy budou.
null.verse 55:53: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:54: Tam budou na kobercích brokátem podšitých odpočívat a plody obou zahrad na dosah ruky mít.
null.verse 55:55: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:56: Tam dívky sklopených zraků, jichž předtím ani muž, ani džin se nedotkl, budou dlít
null.verse 55:57: - které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat? -
null.verse 55:58: jež rubínům a perlám se budou podobat.
null.verse 55:59: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:60: Což odměnou za dobré se něco jiného než dobré může stát?
null.verse 55:61: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:62: A kromě těch dvou tam budou dvě zahrady jiné
null.verse 55:63: - které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat? -
null.verse 55:65: - které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat? -
null.verse 55:66: v nich obou prameny dva budou tryskat.
null.verse 55:67: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:68: Tam ovoce, palmy a jablka granátová budou zrát.
null.verse 55:69: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:70: Tam dívky budou rozkošné a překrásné
null.verse 55:71: - které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat? -
null.verse 55:72: velkých černých očí, ve stanech střežené
null.verse 55:73: - které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat? -
null.verse 55:74: jichž předtím se nedotkla ruka člověka ni džina žádného.
null.verse 55:75: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:76: Tam blažení na poduškách zelených a kobercích překrásných budou spočívat.
null.verse 55:77: Které z dobrodiní Pána svého můžete popírat?
null.verse 55:78: Požehnáno budiž jméno Pána tvého, majestátnosti a velkomyslnosti plného! popírat?

null.verse 55:4: En heeft hem de uiteenzetting (er van) geleerd.
null.verse 55:5: De zon en de maan doorlopen hun banen volgens het plan.
null.verse 55:6: En planten en bomen aanbidden Hem.
null.verse 55:7: Hij heeft de hemel hoog er boven verheven en een evenwicht bepaald
null.verse 55:8: Opdat gij het evenwicht niet zoudt verstoren.
null.verse 55:9: Houdt de weegschaal naar recht en doet aan de maat niet tekort.
null.verse 55:10: En Hij heeft de aarde voor Zijn schepselen gemaakt:
null.verse 55:11: Daarop zijn vruchten en palmbomen met scheden,
null.verse 55:12: En gebolsterd graan en geurige bloemen,
null.verse 55:13: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:14: Hij schiep de mens uit droge klei, als aardewerk.
null.verse 55:15: En Hij schiep de djinn uit de vlam van Vuur.
null.verse 55:16: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:17: De Heer van de twee Oosten en de Heer van de twee Westen!
null.verse 55:18: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:19: Hij heeft de twee zeeën gescheiden, die elkander eens zullen ontmoeten.
null.verse 55:20: Daartussen is een versperring geplaatst welke zij niet kunnen passeren.
null.verse 55:21: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:22: Er komen paarlen en koraal uit beide (zeeën) vandaan.
null.verse 55:23: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:24: En van Hem zijn de bergenhoge schepen op zee.
null.verse 55:25: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:26: Al hetgeen is, zal vergaan.
null.verse 55:27: En er blijft alleen het Aangezicht van uw Heer, de Bezitter van Heerlijkheid en Eer.
null.verse 55:28: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer uilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:29: Van Hem smeken allen, die in de hemelen en op aarde zijn, (gunsten) af.
null.verse 55:30: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:31: Wij zullen spoedig met u afrekenen, o gij twee volkeren!
null.verse 55:32: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:33: O, groep van djinn en mensen; als gij de grenzen der hemelen en der aarde wilt overschrijden, probeert dit dan.
null.verse 55:34: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:35: Er zullen vurige vlammen en gesmolten koper tegen u worden gezonden en gij zult u niet kunnen verweren.
null.verse 55:36: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:37: En wanneer de hemel uiteengespleten en rosssig wordt als een roodgeverfde huid.
null.verse 55:38: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:39: Op die Dag zullen mens noch djinn worden ondervraagd over hun zonden.
null.verse 55:40: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:41: De schuldigen zullen aan hun kenmerken worden herkend en zij zullen worden gegrepen bij haren en voeten.
null.verse 55:42: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:43: Dit is de hel door de schuldigen verloochend.
null.verse 55:44: Zij zullen daar tussen vuur en fel kokend water rondgaan.
null.verse 55:45: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:46: Maar er zullen voor hem die het verschijnen voor zijn Heer vreest, twee tuinen zijn,
null.verse 55:47: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:48: Van verschillende soort.
null.verse 55:49: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:50: In beide zullen twee fonteinen stromen.
null.verse 55:51: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:52: Daarin zullen alle vruchten tweesoortig zijn.
null.verse 55:53: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:54: Zij zullen zich nedervlijen op divans met tapijten waarvan de voeringen van dikke zijde zullen zijn.
null.verse 55:55: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:56: Daarin zullen kuise meisjes zijn met zedige blik, door mens noch djinn ooit aangeraakt.
null.verse 55:57: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:58: Als waren zij robijnen en koralen.
null.verse 55:59: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:60: De beloning van goedheid kan niet anders dan goedheid zijn.
null.verse 55:61: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:62: En naast deze twee zijn er nog twee tuinen.
null.verse 55:63: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:65: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:66: Daarin zullen ook twee bronnen zijn die water in overvloed spuiten.
null.verse 55:67: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:68: In beide zullen er vruchten, dadels en granaatappels zijn.
null.verse 55:69: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:70: Daarin zullen goede en schone meisjes zijn.
null.verse 55:71: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:72: Schonen in paviljoenen gehuisvest.
null.verse 55:73: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:74: Die vóór hen mensen noch djinn hebben aangeraakt.
null.verse 55:75: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:76: Rustend op groene kussens en prachtige tapijten.
null.verse 55:77: Welke van de gunsten van uw Heer wilt gij dan ontkennen?
null.verse 55:78: Gezegend zij de naam van uw Heer, de Bezitter van Heerlijkheid en Eer.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:5: The sun and the moon are made punctual.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:6: The stars and the trees adore.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:7: And the sky He hath uplifted; and He hath set the measure,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:8: That ye exceed not the measure,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:9: But observe the measure strictly, nor fall short thereof.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:10: And the earth hath He appointed for (His) creatures,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:11: Wherein are fruit and sheathed palm-trees,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:13: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:14: He created man of clay like the potter’s,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:15: And the jinn did He create of smokeless fire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:16: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:17: Lord of the two Easts, and Lord of the two Wests!
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:18: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:19: He hath loosed the two seas.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:20: There is a barrier between them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:21: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:22: There cometh forth from both of them the pearl and coral-stone.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:23: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:24: His are the ships displayed upon the sea, like banners.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:25: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:26: Everyone that is thereon will pass away;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:27: There remaineth but the Countenance of thy Lord of Might and Glory.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:28: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:29: All that are in the heavens and the earth entreat Him.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:30: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:31: We shall dispose of you, O ye two dependents (man and jinn).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:32: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:33: O company of jinn and men, if ye have power to penetrate (all) regions of the heavens and the earth, then penetrate (them)! Ye will never penetrate them save with (Our) sanction.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:34: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:35: There will be sent, against you both, heat of fire and flash of brass, and ye will not escape.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:36: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:37: And when the heaven splitteth asunder and becometh rosy like red hide -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:38: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:39: On that day neither man nor jinni will be questioned of his sin.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:40: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:41: The guilty will be known by their marks, and will be taken by the forelocks and the feet.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:42: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:43: This is hell which the guilty deny.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:44: They go circling round between it and fierce, boiling water.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:45: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:46: But for him who feareth the standing before his Lord there are two gardens.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:47: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:49: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:51: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:52: Wherein is every kind of fruit in pairs.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:53: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:54: Reclining upon couches lined with silk brocade, the fruit of both the gardens near to hand.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:55: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:56: Therein are those of modest gaze, whom neither man nor jinni will have touched before them.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:57: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:58: (In beauty) like the jacynth and the coral-stone.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:59: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:60: Is the reward of goodness aught save goodness ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:61: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:62: And beside them are two other gardens,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:63: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:65: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:67: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:68: Wherein is fruit, the date-palm and pomegranate.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:69: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:70: Wherein (are found) the good and beautiful -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:71: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:73: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:74: Whom neither man nor jinni will have touched before them -
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:75: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:76: Reclining on green cushions and fair carpets.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:77: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 55:78: Blessed be the name of thy Lord, Mighty and glorious! ?

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:2: It is He Who has taught the Qur’an.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:4: He has taught him speech (and intelligence).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:5: The sun and the moon follow courses (exactly) computed;
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:6: And the herbs and the trees - both (alike) bow in adoration.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:7: And the Firmament has He raised high, and He has set up the Balance (of Justice),
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:8: In order that ye may not transgress (due) balance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:9: So establish weight with justice and fall not short in the balance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:10: It is He Who has spread out the earth for (His) creatures:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:11: Therein is fruit and date-palms, producing spathes (enclosing dates);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:12: Also corn, with (its) leaves and stalk for fodder, and sweet-smelling plants.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:13: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:14: He created man from sounding clay like unto pottery,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:15: And He created Jinns from fire free of smoke:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:16: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:17: (He is) Lord of the two Easts and Lord of the two Wests:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:18: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:19: He has let free the two bodies of flowing water, meeting together:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:20: Between them is a Barrier which they do not transgress:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:21: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:22: Out of them come Pearls and Coral:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:23: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:24: And His are the Ships sailing smoothly through the seas, lofty as mountains:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:25: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:26: All that is on earth will perish:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:27: But will abide (for ever) the Face of thy Lord,- full of Majesty, Bounty and Honour.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:28: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:29: Of Him seeks (its need) every creature in the heavens and on earth: every day in (new) Splendour doth He (shine)!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:30: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:31: Soon shall We settle your affairs, O both ye worlds!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:32: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:33: O ye assembly of Jinns and men! If it be ye can pass beyond the zones of the heavens and the earth, pass ye! not without authority shall ye be able to pass!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:34: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:35: On you will be sent (O ye evil ones twain!) a flame of fire (to burn) and a smoke (to choke): no defence will ye have:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:36: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:37: When the sky is rent asunder, and it becomes red like ointment:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:38: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:39: On that Day no question will be asked of man or Jinn as to his sin.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:40: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:41: (For) the sinners will be known by their marks: and they will be seized by their forelocks and their feet.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:42: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:43: This is the Hell which the Sinners deny:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:44: In its midst and in the midst of boiling hot water will they wander round!
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:45: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:46: But for such as fear the time when they will stand before (the Judgment Seat of) their Lord, there will be two Gardens-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:47: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:48: Containing all kinds (of trees and delights);-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:49: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:50: In them (each) will be two Springs flowing (free);
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:51: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:52: In them will be Fruits of every kind, two and two.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:53: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:54: They will recline on Carpets, whose inner linings will be of rich brocade: the Fruit of the Gardens will be near (and easy of reach).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:55: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:56: In them will be (Maidens), chaste, restraining their glances, whom no man or Jinn before them has touched;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:57: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:59: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:60: Is there any Reward for Good - other than Good?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:61: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:62: And besides these two, there are two other Gardens,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:63: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:65: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:66: In them (each) will be two Springs pouring forth water in continuous abundance:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:67: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:68: In them will be Fruits, and dates and pomegranates:
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:69: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:70: In them will be fair (Companions), good, beautiful;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:71: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:72: Companions restrained (as to their glances), in (goodly) pavilions;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:73: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:74: Whom no man or Jinn before them has touched;-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:75: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:76: Reclining on green Cushions and rich Carpets of beauty.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:77: Then which of the favours of your Lord will ye deny?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 55:78: Blessed be the name of thy Lord, full of Majesty, Bounty and Honour.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:4: and He has taught him the Explanation.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:5: The sun and the moon to a reckoning,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:6: and the stars and the trees bow themselves;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:7: and heaven -- He raised it up, and set the Balance.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:9: and weigh with justice, and skimp not in the Balance.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:10: And earth -- He set it down for all beings,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:11: therein fruits, and palm-trees with sheaths,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:12: and grain in the blade, and fragrant herbs.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:13: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:14: He created man of a clay like the potter’s,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:15: and He created the jinn of a smokeless fire.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:16: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:17: Lord of the Two Easts, Lord of the Two Wests,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:18: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:19: He let forth the two seas that meet together,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:20: between them a barrier they do not overpass.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:21: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:22: From them come forth the pearl and the coral.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:23: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:24: His too are the ships that run, raised up in the sea like land-marks.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:25: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:26: All that dwells upon the earth is perishing,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:27: yet still abides the Face of thy Lord, majestic, splendid.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:28: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:29: Whatsoever is in the heavens and the earth implore Him; every day He is upon some labour.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:30: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:31: We shall surely attend to you at leisure, you weight and you weight!
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:32: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:33: O tribe of jinn and of men, if you are able to pass through the confines of heaven and earth, pass through them! You shall not pass through except with an authority.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:34: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:35: Against you shall be loosed a flame of fire, and molten brass; and you shall not be helped.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:36: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:37: And when heaven is split asunder, and turns crimson like red leather --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:38: O which of our Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:39: on that day none shall be questioned about his sin, neither man nor jinn.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:40: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:41: The sinners shall be known by their mark, and they shall be seized by their forelocks and their feet.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:42: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:43: This is Gehenna, that sinners cried lies to;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:44: they shall go round between it and between hot, boiling water.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:45: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:46: But such as fears the Station of his Lord, for them shall be two gardens --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:47: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:49: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:50: therein two fountains of running water --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:51: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:52: therein of every fruit two kinds --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:53: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:54: reclining upon couches lined with brocade, the fruits of the gardens nigh to gather --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:55: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:56: therein maidens restraining their glances, untouched before them by any man or jinn --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:57: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:58: lovely as rubies, beautiful as coral --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:59: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:60: Shall the recompense of goodness be other than goodness?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:61: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:62: And besides these shall be two gardens --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:63: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:65: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:66: therein two fountains of gushing water --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:67: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:68: therein fruits, and palm-trees, and pomegranates --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:69: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:71: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:73: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:74: untouched before them by any man or jinn --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:75: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:76: reclining upon green cushions and lovely druggets --
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:77: O which of your Lord’s bounties will you and you deny?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 55:78: Blessed be the Name of thy Lord, majestic, splendid.

Muhammad Asad.verse 55:4: He has imparted unto him articulate thought and speech.
Muhammad Asad.verse 55:5: [At His behest] the sun and the moon run their appointed courses;
Muhammad Asad.verse 55:6: [before Him] prostrate themselves the stars and the trees.

Muhammad Asad.verse 55:8: so that you [too, O men,] might never transgress the measure [of what is right]:
Muhammad Asad.verse 55:9: weigh, therefore, [your deeds] with equity, and cut not the measure short!

Muhammad Asad.verse 55:11: with fruit thereon, and palm trees with sheathed clusters [of dates],
Muhammad Asad.verse 55:12: and grain growing tall on its stalks, and sweet-smelling plants.

Muhammad Asad.verse 55:98: circumscribed and made clear” (Rāghib) – applies to both thought and speech inasmuch as it comprises the faculty of making a thing or an idea apparent to the mind and conceptually distinct from other things or ideas, as well as the power to express this cognition clearly in spoken or written language (Tāj al-‘Arūs): hence, in the above context, “articulate thought and speech,” recalling the “knowledge of all the names” (i.

Martin Lings.verse 55:13: The sun and the moon have their span.
Martin Lings.verse 55:14: And the star and the tree do obeisance.
Martin Lings.verse 55:15: The heaven hath He raised aloft; and He hath let down the scales.
Martin Lings.verse 55:16: That ye transgress not in the measure.
Martin Lings.verse 55:17: Set ye the weight right; nor come ye short of the measure.
Martin Lings.verse 55:18: And the earth hath He laid down for mankind.
Martin Lings.verse 55:19: Therein is fruit and the date palm bearing sheaths.
Martin Lings.verse 55:20: And grains decked in greenery and odorous herbs.
